intro: Criosanthes parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered cryosanthes, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming structure. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in its arid habitat. Criosanthes parviflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded, humid environments.
